trial_identification.studytitle: Efficacy of strain-counterstrain technique to produce immediate changes in pressure pain thresholds in tender points at the elbow
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The efficacy of strain-counterstrain technique to produce changes in pressure pain thresholds and pain intensity as reported by VAS in adults with palpable tender points at the elbow

interventions.interventions:
Single application of strain-counterstrain an osteopathic technique.
The treatment lasted for about 5 minutes. The treatment was administered by a trained manual therapist with over 10 years experience using strain counterstrain.
interventions.comparator: Single application of sham strain-counterstrain an osteopathic technique. The practitioner placed the subjects arm in a position where no change in pain intensity was reported on palpation and no noticeable change in tissue tension was observed by palpation over the tenderpoint. The procedure lasted for about 5 minutes.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Pressure pain threshold Was measured using a mechanical pressure algometer (Activator Methods Algometer, Activator Methods International Ltd, Phoenix AZ) Downwards pressure applied perpendicular to skin at marked tenderpoint.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Pain-free grip strength Was measured using a strain gauge hand dynamometer (Smedley's Dynamometer, TTM, Tokyo)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Aged 18-65 years Current palpable tender point in elbow region Able to understand English language
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Signs or symptoms of cervical radiculopathy Presence of medical condition that could interfere with the therapy History of long-term steroid usage Use of analgesics in previous 24 hours

trial_design.concealment: All subjects who met inclusion criteria were randomised to either the intervention group or the sham group. Allocation was concealed from research assistant and participant. Allocation concealed by use of sealed opaque envelopes.
trial_design.sequence: Single block randomisation schedule generated prior to enrolment using an Internet-based computer programme (www.randomization.com) set for the target number of participants.
trial_design.designfeatures: Immediate Pre- Post intervention analysis no follow-up period.
trial_design.statisticalmethods:
Within-group differences assessed with paired t-tests. Between-group differences assessed with independent t-tests. Analysis of effect sizes by magnitude-based inferences.
Prior to the study, calculations showed that a sample size of 10 participants per group would be required to detect a change in VAS of an effect size of 1.2 assuming 80% statistical power and alpha = 5%. An additional 2 participants per group was targeted to allow for possible withdrawals from the study.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Carrington Rd, Mt Albert Private Bag 92025 Victoria Street West Auckland 1142

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Carrington Rd, Mt Albert Private Bag 92025 Victoria Street West Auckland 1142

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To assess the efficacy of the immediate effects of a single application of an osteopathic technique, strain-counterstrain, on pressure pain thresholds and pain intensity in subjects with elbow pain.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Research Office and Postgraduate Centre Unitec Institute of Technology Carrington Rd, Mt Albert Private Bag 92025 Victoria Street West Auckland 1142
